oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conjugated Polyfluorene-based Reversible Fluorescent Sensor for Cu(II) and Cyanide Ions in Aqueous Medium
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHAKRABORTY, C
SINGH, P
MAJI, SK
MALIK, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: METAL-IONS
SELECTIVE CHEMOSENSOR
ANION RECOGNITION
CHEMICAL SENSORS
POLYMERS
AMPLIFICATION
WATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A blue emissive polyfluorene bearing sulfate functionality in the side chain (PFS), as a sensory polymer to selectively report the presence of Cu2+ (detection limit down to 2.5 mu M) based on the fluorescence "turn-off." Surprisingly, the quenched luminescence of PFS by Cu2+ could be turned on after the addition of CN- (detection limit down to 6 mu M), making PFS a sensitive, selective, and reversible cyanide probe.
